children.name: mega_menu
children.label: Use Mega Menu
children.help_text:
There are additional steps required to set up the Mega Menu which you can find here:

happy.helpfulhero.com/global-header#mega-menu
children.inline_help_text: Awesome when you need to display a ton of subpages.

children.name: use_side_menu_desktop
children.label: Use Side Menu on Desktop
children.help_text: This will automatically display on tablet and mobile according to your settings.
children.inline_help_text: Also known as the hamburger menu.

children.name: use_cta
children.label: Include CTA(s) / Buttons
children.help_text: This will add CTA(s) or buttons in the top right corner of the navbar or hamburger menu.

children.name: use_search
children.label: Include Site Search Icon
children.help_text: Be sure to go into your Content Settings to attribute the CLEAN search results template.
children.inline_help_text: Search page and blog content throughout your website.

children.name: search_placeholder
children.label: Search Placeholder
children.inline_help_text: The text prompt inside the input field.

children.name: use_multilingual_search
children.label: Show Results in Viewed Language Only:
children.help_text: Keep this off if you'd like the person to see all search results in all languages.
children.inline_help_text: Turning this on will ONLY display search results from pages in the language the person is viewing your website in.

children.name: use_sticky_header
children.label: Use Sticky Header
children.inline_help_text: Displays global header as visitor scrolls down.

children.name: sticky_slide_in
children.label: Sticky Header Slide-in Control
children.inline_help_text: This lets you set how soon you want the sticky header to slide down.  Set to 1 for it to slide in instantly.

children.name: sticky_header_on_mobile
children.label: Sticky Header on Mobile/Tablet
children.help_text: Because screen real estate is tight you'll want to be mindful of using this feature.
children.inline_help_text: This will keep the sticky header at the top on mobile & tablet devices.

children.name: use_header_hat
children.label: Use Header "Hat"
children.inline_help_text: The thin bar above the main navigation links.

children.name: header_overlap
children.label: Use Header Overlap
children.help_text: This looks great when the global header has a transparent background and overlaps on an image, gradient, or cool color.
children.inline_help_text: Overlaps header on the module below.

children.name: standard
children.label: Upload Your Logo (Primary Header):
children.help_text: Upload a version of your logo that will work on top of the background color you select for the header. If you are going with a transparent header, I highly suggest going with a clean white logo with a transparent background.
children.inline_help_text: Adjust logo size with sliders below.

children.name: size_desktop
children.label: Logo Size (Desktop):
children.help_text: This will give you the ability to set the max-width of the logo that's viewed on desktop.  The height of the logo will scale in proportion to the height.

children.name: size_mobile
children.label: Logo Size (Mobile):
children.help_text: This will give you the ability to set the max-width of the logo that's viewed on mobile. Typically, you're going to want this to be smaller. Especially if you select to show a CTA as well.

children.name: sticky
children.label: Upload Your Logo (Sticky Header):
children.help_text: Upload a version of your logo that will work on top of a white background. Typically, this will be the color version of your logo.
children.inline_help_text: This is also used as the ALTERNATIVE nav style.

children.name: size_sticky
children.label: Logo Size (Sticky Desktop):
children.help_text: This will give you the ability to set the max-width of the logo that's viewed on desktop.  The height of the logo will scale in proportion to the height.

children.name: set_custom_link
children.label: Set Custom Link
children.inline_help_text: This will override the settings in your Brand Kit (where you set the link for when the logo is clicked).

children.name: space_above_logo
children.label: Space Above Logo
children.help_text: This will help you fine tune the alignment of your logo in relation to the navigation.

children.name: use_std_btns
children.label: Use Standard Buttons:
children.help_text: Turning this feature on will disable the HubSpot CTA options above.  This feature is NOT recommended for those using HubSpot CMS Pro and above.
children.inline_help_text: For CMS STARTER accounts that don't have access to the HubSpot CTA feature.

children.name: style
children.label: Style
children.help_text: Styles will reflect what you have set in your Theme Settings.

children.name: std_btn_2
children.label: Standard Button 2
children.inline_help_text: To hide this button entirely, simply do not include any text in the button label.

children.name: style
children.label: Style
children.help_text: Styles will reflect what you have set in your Theme Settings.

children.name: accessibility_skip_to_content
children.label: Accessibility - Skip to Content
children.inline_help_text: This is the text that screen readers will read that allows someone to skip over the navigation links to read the main content.

children.name: use_extras_menu
children.label: Add Extras Menu:
children.inline_help_text: Great for secondary links.

children.name: side_menu_form
children.label: Select Form
children.inline_help_text: Pro-Tip: Keep this form super simple.

children.name: facebook_url
children.label: Facebook URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: instagram_url
children.label: Instagram URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: twitter_url
children.label: Twitter URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: youtube_url
children.label: Youtube URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: linkedin_url
children.label: LinkedIn URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: medium_url
children.label: Medium URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: telegram_url
children.label: Telegram URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: tiktok_url
children.label: Tiktok URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: discord_url
children.label: Discord URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: pinterest_url
children.label: Pinterest URL
children.help_text: Leave blank if you don't want to show the icon.

children.name: display
children.label: What would you like to display?

children.name: text
children.label: Add Text
children.inline_help_text: Go into dark-mode to see white text.
children.default: Add your text here.

children.name: simple_menu
children.label: Simple Menu
children.help_text: This simple menu does not support sub-navigation links.
children.inline_help_text: Keep it simple.

default.text: Add your text here.

children.name: translate
children.label: Add Translated Elements:
children.help_text: This feature was built into CLEAN prior to HubSpot allowing for Smart Rules to work with custom modules. Now that they do, you should definitely use them.
children.inline_help_text: Recommended: Use HubSpot Smart Rule instead of this feature.

children.name: default_lang_url
children.label: Set Default Language URL abbreviation (Website/Landing Pages):)
children.help_text: This will need to be the same default language that you have set up in your content settings.  In most cases this is going to be English (en) in which you won't need to edit this. But if you've selected a different default language you'll want to add the URL abbreviation for that here.  For more info, check out the CLEAN documentation.

children.name: default_lang_url_blog
children.label: Set Default Language URL abbreviation (Blog)
children.help_text: In many cases, you won't need to adjust this if your blog is in English. In some cases the "language code" that's generated for the blog may be different than what is set on website page. It's easy to check. For more info, head on over to www.hubspothero.com/clean6/documentation to see how.

children.name: lang_url
children.label: What is the Language's URL abbreviation? (EX: fr for French)
children.help_text: This is an important step to get right.  You can find the Language URL when creating any translated page once you've selected the Language.

children.name: style
children.label: Style
children.help_text: Styles will reflect what you have set in your Theme Settings.

children.name: style
children.label: Style
children.help_text: Styles will reflect what you have set in your Theme Settings.

children.name: menu_form_translated
children.label: Select Form
children.inline_help_text: For the side menu.

children.name: header_hat_content_translated
children.label: Header "Hat" Content
children.inline_help_text: If the header hat is OFF disregard this.

children.name: header_hat_menu_translated
children.label: Header "Hat" Menu
children.inline_help_text: If the header hat is OFF disregard this.

header_hat.text: Add your text here.

children.name: nav_menu_align
children.label: Navigation Alignment:
children.help_text: This will only control the menu text links. The Hamburger Menu, CTA(s), Search, and Translation icon will remain anchored to the right side.
children.inline_help_text: This will align the main navigation links.

children.name: header_bg_color
children.label: Standard Header Background Color:
children.help_text: If you'd like a transparent background just set the opacity to 0%. Or a solid color set it to 100%.

children.name: standard_underline_color
children.label: Standard Underline Color
children.inline_help_text: This is for the active and hover state.

children.name: header_cta_font_size
children.label: Header CTA Font Size:
children.help_text: This gives you the ability to make the button in the header slightly different than your global settings.

children.name: cta_padding_tb
children.label: CTA - Padding Top/Bottom
children.help_text: This gives you the ability to make the button in the header slightly different than your global settings.
children.inline_help_text: This controls how tall the button is.

children.name: cta_padding_rl
children.label: CTA - Padding Right/Left
children.help_text: This gives you the ability to make the button in the header slightly different than your global settings.
children.inline_help_text: This controls how wide the button is.

children.name: sticky_header_bg_color
children.label: Sticky Header Background Color:
children.help_text: I suggest using a solid color so that it remains readable as it will scroll over other content on the page.

children.name: sticky_underline_color
children.label: Sticky Underline Color
children.inline_help_text: This is for the active and hover state.

children.name: nav_spacing
children.label: Spacing Between Nav Links (Top Level):
children.help_text: This will give you the power to increase or decrease the spacing between each Link in the navigation bar.

children.name: bg_color
children.label: Background Color:
children.help_text: This will give you the option to select the background color of the drop down menu on both desktop and mobile.

children.name: link_color
children.label: Link Color:
children.help_text: This will give you the option to select the text color of the drop down menu items on both desktop and mobile.

children.name: dd_mt
children.label: Drop Down Menu (Margin top):
children.help_text: Use this setting to fine tune the position of the mobile dropdown menu according to the height of your navigation bar.

children.name: sub_nav_bg_hover
children.label: Sub Nav Background Color (Hover):
children.help_text: This is the background color that will appear when you hover over a sub nav item in the dropdown menu on desktop.

children.name: sub_nav_text_hover
children.label: Sub Nav Text Color (Hover):
children.help_text: This is the background color that will appear when you hover over a sub nav item in the dropdown menu on desktop.

children.name: sub_nav_bg_active
children.label: Sub Nav Background Color (Active):
children.inline_help_text: The color signifies that the person is viewing this current page.

children.name: sub_nav_text_active
children.label: Sub Nav Text Color (Active):
children.help_text: This is the background color that will appear when you hover over a sub nav item in the dropdown menu on desktop.

children.name: sub_nav_line_color
children.label: Sub Nav Line & Background Color Tone
children.help_text: Use this depending on the background color you select for the drop down nav.  This will show up when viewing the mobile menu.

children.name: hamburger
children.label: /// Side Menu
children.inline_help_text: Otherwise, known as the "Hamburger Menu." (My fav: the double-double)

children.name: menu_width
children.label: Menu Width
children.inline_help_text: This sets how far the side menu will slide out.

children.name: side_menu_overlay_color
children.label: Side Menu Overlay Color
children.inline_help_text: This is the color that fades out the rest of the screen when the side menu is active.

children.name: icon_open_color
children.label: Icon Open Color (Standard)
children.inline_help_text: The color of the hamburger icon for the standard header.

children.name: icon_open_color_sticky
children.label: Icon Open Color (sticky):
children.inline_help_text: The color of the hamburger icon for the sticky header.

children.name: icon_close_color
children.label: Icon Close Color
children.inline_help_text: This is for the X icon used to close the sidebar.

children.name: menu_icon_color
children.label: Menu  ( + ) Icon Color:
children.inline_help_text: The little + to the right of the link if there are sub-links underneath.

children.name: main_menu_font_size
children.label: Main Menu Font Size:
children.inline_help_text: This controls the main navigation links.

children.name: form_text_color
children.label: Form Text Color:
children.inline_help_text: Labels, GDPR text, etc.

children.name: responsive
children.label: /// Responsive Settings:
children.inline_help_text: This will let you set specific screen sizes for when you want elements from the header to teleport into the side menu.

children.name: cta_1_side_menu
children.label: Move CTA 1 to the Side Menu at:
children.inline_help_text: Set the screen size when you'd like CTA 1 to teleport into the side menu. You want this number to be less than the CTA 2 (if you have one).

children.name: cta_2_side_menu
children.label: Move CTA 2 to the Side Menu at:
children.inline_help_text: Set the screen size when you'd like CTA 2 to teleport into the side menu.

children.name: main_nav_side_menu
children.label: Move Main Nav to the Side Menu at:
children.inline_help_text: Set the screen size when you'd like the main nav to teleport into the side menu.

children.name: pos_top
children.label: Position from Top (Standard):
children.help_text: This is going to help you fine tune where the mega menu drops in based on the height of your STANDARD header bar.

children.name: pos_top_sticky
children.label: Position from Top (Sticky):
children.help_text: This is going to help you fine tune where the mega menu drops in based on the height of your STICK header bar. This will likely be smaller than your STANDARD header.

children.name: link_tb_padding
children.label: Link Top/Bottom Padding:
children.inline_help_text: Sets how close the links are to each other.

children.name: bridge_height
children.label: Bridge Height
children.help_text: If you have a tall nav bar or set the mega menu further down from the top, you'll want to increase the height of the "invisible bridge." This will make sure that the mega menu won't disappear when a visitor tries to navigation their cursor to it.
children.inline_help_text: Helps a visitor move their cursor from the link to the mega menu.

children.name: bridge_color_guide
children.label: Bridge Color Guide
children.inline_help_text: This is only to help you get the right bridge height. Set the opacity to 50% to see the bridge. Be sure to set it back to 0% when. you've got it just right.

children.name: padding_tb
children.label: Padding Top/Bottom
children.inline_help_text: To control the space above/below the text or menu. Basically, it will control the height.

children.name: text_link_padding_tb
children.label: Text Link - Padding Top/Bottom
children.help_text: SEO Tip: All clickable elements should be a minimum of 48x48px. This option will allow you to better optimize for SEO by making the clickable area of the link taller.
children.inline_help_text: This helps set the (clickable) height of the text links.

children.name: hide_hat_on_mobile
children.label: Hide "Hat" on Mobile
children.help_text: If you have quite a few nav items in the header hat, you may want it hidden on mobile.

children.name: mega_menu_name
children.label: Mega Menu Name:
children.help_text: This is only to help you organized the list of mega menus. It will not display in the mega menu.

children.name: num_cols
children.label: How Many Columns Do You Want?

children.name: text
children.label: Rich Text:
children.help_text: If you don't want text, simply leave this blank.

children.name: text
children.label: Rich Text:
children.help_text: If you don't want text, simply leave this blank.

children.name: text
children.label: Rich Text:
children.help_text: If you don't want text, simply leave this blank.

children.name: text
children.label: Rich Text:
children.help_text: If you don't want text, simply leave this blank.
